info.title: Associations
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: When an existing contact has moved to a new company, update their associated company to keep your CRM up to date.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the associations API to create, retrieve, update, or delete associations between records, or between records and activities.

post.description: Create a batch of CRM objects with specified properties and associations.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of CRM object to create in the batch operation.

post.summary: Merge two CRM objects of the specified type, combining their properties and associations into a single object.
post.description: Merge two CRM objects of the specified type into one.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of CRM object to merge.

post.description: Permanently delete a contact and all associated content to follow GDPR. Use optional property 'idProperty' set to 'email' to identify contact by email address. If email address is not found, the email address will be added to a blocklist and prevent it from being used in the future.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of CRM object to permanently delete in compliance with GDPR.

post.summary: Archive a batch of objects by ID
post.description: Archive a batch of objects identified by their IDs.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of CRM object to archive in the batch operation.

get.description: Read an Object identified by `{objectId}`. `{objectId}` refers to the internal object ID by default, or optionally any unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query param.  Control what is returned via the `properties` query param.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: The type of the object being retrieved.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the object to be retrieved.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A list of property names to include in the response.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A list of property names to include in the response with their history.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A list of associations to include in the response.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to include archived objects in the response.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: Specifies a unique property to identify the object instead of the default ID.

delete.description: Move an Object identified by `{objectId}` to the recycling bin.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: The type of the object to be deleted.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the object to be deleted.

patch.description: Perform a partial update of an Object identified by `{objectId}`. `{objectId}` refers to the internal object ID by default, or optionally any unique property value as specified by the `idProperty` query param. Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will be ignored. Properties values can be cleared by passing an empty string.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: The type of the object to be updated.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the object to be updated.

parameters.name: idProperty
parameters.description: Specifies a unique property to identify the object instead of the default ID for updating.

post.summary: Read a batch of objects by internal ID, or unique property values
post.description: Retrieve a batch of CRM objects using their internal IDs or unique property values.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of CRM object to be read in the batch operation.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Indicates whether to include archived objects in the batch read operation, with a default value of false.

put.description: Set association labels between two records.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the source object in the association to be created.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the source object in the association to be created.

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the target object in the association to be created.

parameters.name: toObjectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the target object in the association to be created.

delete.description: deletes all associations between two records.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the source object in the association to be deleted.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the source object in the association to be deleted.

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the target object in the association to be deleted.

parameters.name: toObjectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the target object in the association to be deleted.

get.description: List all associations of an object by object type. Limit 500 per call.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the source object in the association.

parameters.name: objectId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the source object whose associations are being retrieved.

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the target object in the association.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: fromObjectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the source object in the batch association deletion.

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the target object in the batch association deletion.

parameters.name: fromObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the from Object

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the to Object

post.summary: Upsert a batch of CRM objects by their internal ID or unique property values.
post.description: Upsert a batch of CRM objects, creating new records or updating existing ones based on their internal IDs or unique property values.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of CRM object to upsert in the batch operation.

post.description: Requests a report of all objects in the portal which have a high usage of associations

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The user for the report

post.description: Batch delete specific association labels for objects. Deleting an unlabeled association will also delete all labeled associations between those two objects

parameters.name: fromObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the from Object

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the to Object

post.description: Batch read associations for objects to specific object type. The 'after' field in a returned paging object  can be added alongside the 'id' to retrieve the next page of associations from that objectId. The 'link' field is deprecated and should be ignored. Note: The 'paging' field will only be present if there are more pages and absent otherwise.

parameters.name: fromObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the from Object

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the to Object

put.description: Create the default (most generic) association type between two object types

parameters.name: fromObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the source object in the association.

parameters.name: fromObjectId
parameters.description: The ID of the source object in the association.

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: The type of the target object in the association.

parameters.name: toObjectId
parameters.description: The ID of the target object in the association.

get.description: Read a page of objects. Control what is returned via the `properties` query param.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of CRM object to retrieve.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page, default is 10.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A list of property names to include in the response.

parameters.name: propertiesWithHistory
parameters.description: A list of property names to include in the response with their history.

parameters.name: associations
parameters.description: A list of associations to include in the response.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to include archived objects in the response, default is false.

post.description: Create a CRM object with the given properties and return a copy of the object, including the ID. Documentation and examples for creating standard objects is provided.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of CRM object to create.

post.summary: Update a batch of objects by internal ID, or unique property values
post.description: Update a batch of CRM objects using their internal IDs or unique property values.

parameters.name: objectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of CRM object to update in the batch operation.

post.description: Create the default (most generic) association type between two object types

parameters.name: fromObjectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the source object in the association.

parameters.name: toObjectType
parameters.description: Specifies the type of the target object in the association.

createdResourceId.description: The unique identifier of the newly created resource.

location.description: The URL location of the newly created resource.

fromObjectTypeId.description: The type ID of the source object in the association.

toObjectId.description: The ID of the target object in the association.

toObjectTypeId.description: The type ID of the target object in the association.

fromObjectId.description: The ID of the source object in the association.

labels.description: An array of labels associated with the relationship between the objects.

total.description: The total number of objects in the collection.

completedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch processing was completed, in ISO 8601 format.

numErrors.description: The number of errors encountered during the batch processing.

requestedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch request was initially made, in ISO 8601 format.

startedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch processing began, in ISO 8601 format.

links.description: An object containing relevant links related to the batch request.

status.description: The status of the batch processing request: "PENDING", "PROCESSING", "CANCELLED", or "COMPLETE"

BatchResponseSimplePublicObject.description: A public object batch response object

toObjectId.description: The unique identifier for the target object in the association.

dateOnly.description: Indicates whether the DateTime value represents only a date without a time component.

timeZoneShift.description: The integer value representing the shift in minutes from UTC for the DateTime value.

value.description: The integer value representing a specific point in time.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

createdResourceId.description: The unique identifier of the newly created resource.

location.description: The URL location of the newly created resource.

completedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch process was completed, in ISO 8601 format.

requestedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch process was initiated, in ISO 8601 format.

startedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch process began execution, in ISO 8601 format.

links.description: An object containing relevant links related to the batch request.

status.description: The status of the batch processing request. Can be: "PENDING", "PROCESSING", "CANCELED", or "COMPLETE".

BatchResponseSimplePublicUpsertObject.description: Represents the result of a batch upsert operation, including the operations status, timestamps, and a list of successfully created or updated objects.

propertiesWithHistory.description: Key-value pairs for setting properties for the new object and their histories.

idProperty.description: A unique property used to identify objects instead of the default ID.

properties.description: Key-value pairs for setting properties for the new object.

BatchReadInputSimplePublicObjectId.description: Specifies the input for reading a batch of CRM objects, including arrays of object IDs, requested property names (with optional history), and an optional unique identifying property.

completedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch processing was completed, in ISO 8601 format.

numErrors.description: The number of errors encountered during the batch processing.

requestedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch request was initially made, in ISO 8601 format.

startedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch processing began, in ISO 8601 format.

links.description: An object containing relevant links related to the batch request.

status.description: The status of the batch processing request: "PENDING", "PROCESSING", "CANCELLED", or "COMPLETE".

idProperty.description: The name of a unique identifier property, which can be used for identifying objects instead of the object ID.

objectWriteTraceId.description: An identifier for tracing the creation request.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

properties.description: Key value pairs representing the properties of the object.

SimplePublicObjectBatchInputUpsert.description: Represents an object used in batch upsert operations, containing an objects unique identifier, its properties, and optionally the unique property name and a write trace ID.

completedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch processing was completed, in ISO 8601 format.

numErrors.description: The number of errors encountered during the batch processing.

requestedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch request was initially made, in ISO 8601 format.

startedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch processing began, in ISO 8601 format.

links.description: An object containing relevant links related to the batch request.

status.description: The status of the batch processing request: "PENDING", "PROCESSING", "CANCELED", or "COMPLETE".

completedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch process was completed, in ISO 8601 format.

numErrors.description: The number of errors encountered during the batch processing.

requestedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch process was initiated, in ISO 8601 format.

startedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch process began execution, in ISO 8601 format.

links.description: An object containing relevant links related to the batch request.

status.description: The status of the batch processing request: "PENDING", "PROCESSING", "CANCELLED", or "COMPLETE".

objectIdToMerge.description: The unique identifier of the CRM object that will be merged into the primary object.

primaryObjectId.description: The unique identifier of the CRM object that will remain after the merge.

associations.description: A list defining relationships with other objects.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the object was created, in ISO 8601 format.

archivedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was archived, in ISO 8601 format.

propertiesWithHistory.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object along with their history.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

objectWriteTraceId.description: A unique identifier for tracing the creation request.

properties.description: Key value pairs representing the properties of the object.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

SimplePublicObjectWithAssociations.description: Represents a CRM object along with its properties, timestamps, and a set of associated object IDs grouped by association type.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the object was created, in ISO 8601 format.

archivedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was archived, in ISO 8601 format.

propertiesWithHistory.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object along with their history.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

objectWriteTraceId.description: A unique identifier for tracing the creation or update request.

properties.description: Key value pairs representing the properties of the object.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

SimplePublicUpsertObject.description: Represents a CRM object that has either been created or updated (upserted)

idProperty.description: The name of a unique identifier property, which can be used for identifying objects instead of the object ID.

objectWriteTraceId.description: A unique identifier for tracing the request.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

properties.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object.

SimplePublicObjectBatchInput.description: Contains an array of CRM object records to be processed in a batch operation, each defined by their ID and properties.

numErrors.description: The number of errors encountered during the batch processing.

requestedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch request was initially made, in ISO 8601 format.

startedAt.description: The timestamp when the batch processing began, in ISO 8601 format.

links.description: An object containing relevant links related to the batch request.

status.description: The status of the batch processing request: "PENDING", "PROCESSING", "CANCELED", or "COMPLETE".

id.description: The unique identifier for the object whose associations are being fetched.

after.description: A paging cursor token used to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated response.

subCategory.description: A more specific error category within each main category.

context.description: Additional context-specific information related to the error.

links.description: URLs linking to documentation or resources associated with the error.

id.description: A unique ID for the error instance.

category.description: The main category of the error.

message.description: A human-readable string describing the error and possible remediation steps.

status.description: The HTTP status code associated with the error.

typeId.description: The unique identifier for the type of association.

label.description: A label describing the association between two objects.

category.description: The category of the association, such as HUBSPOT_DEFINED, USER_DEFINED, or INTEGRATOR_DEFINED.

sourceId.description: The unique ID of the property.

updatedByUserId.description: The ID of the user who last updated the property.

timestamp.description: The timestamp when the property was updated, in ISO 8601 format.

createdAt.description: The timestamp when the object was created, in ISO 8601 format.

archivedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was archived, in ISO 8601 format.

propertiesWithHistory.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object along with their history.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

objectWriteTraceId.description: A unique identifier for tracing the creation request.

properties.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object.

updatedAt.description: The timestamp when the object was last updated, in ISO 8601 format.

query.description: The search query string, up to 3000 characters.

limit.description: The maximum results to return, up to 200 objects.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

sorts.description: Specifies sorting order based on object properties.

properties.description: A list of property names to include in the response.

filterGroups.description: Up to 6 groups of filters defining additional query criteria.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

properties.description: Key value pairs representing the properties of the object.

SimplePublicObjectInput.description: Represents the input required to create or update a CRM object, containing an object with property names and their corresponding values.

associationCategory.description: The category of the association, such as "HUBSPOT_DEFINED".

associationTypeId.description: The ID representing the specific type of association.

AssociationSpec.description: Defines the type, direction, and details of the relationship between two CRM objects.

highValue.description: The upper boundary value when using ranged-based filters.

propertyName.description: The name of the property to apply the filter to.

values.description: The values to match against the property.

value.description: The value to match against the property.

operator.description: The comparison operator used in the filter, such as "EQ" or "GT".

Filter.description: Defines a single condition for searching CRM objects, specifying the property to filter on, the operator to use (such as equals, greater than, or contains), and the value(s) to compare against.

before.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving previous pages.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the previous pages' results.

PreviousPage.description: specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the previous set of results in a paginated API response

objectWriteTraceId.description: A unique identifier for tracing the creation request.

properties.description: Key-value pairs representing the properties of the object.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

NextPage.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

id.description: The ID for the association type.

AssociatedId.description: Contains the id and type of an association

properties.description: Key-value pairs for setting properties for the new object.

SimplePublicObjectInputForCreate.description: Is the input object used to create a new CRM object, containing the properties to be set and optional associations to link the new record with other CRM objects.
